meanings.definition: In a way that is not guided by reason or logic.
meanings.sent1: She unreasonably believed that the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent2: He unreasonably refused to listen to any other opinions.
meanings.sent3: The cat unreasonably thought it could fly like a bird.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of spiders made her unreasonably scream at the sight of a tiny spider.
meanings.sent5: The child unreasonably insisted that the sky was purple.

meanings.definition: To an excessive or unjustifiable degree.
meanings.sent1: He unreasonably demanded a refund for the slightly damaged product.
meanings.sent2: She unreasonably spent all her money on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unreasonably hoarded acorns in its tiny nest.
meanings.sent4: The tree unreasonably blocked the sunlight from reaching the smaller plants.
meanings.sent5: The student unreasonably complained about the length of the assignment.
